text: - Welcome to 'This is My Architecture'.

I am Hawn and today I am joined
by Bindi from GoDaddy.
Welcome.
- Hey, thanks for having me.

- Before we go into your architecture, can
you tell us a little bit about GoDaddy?
- Sure.

At a very high level, GoDaddy
empowers our everyday entrepreneurs
to live out their dreams,

so that they can focus on the products
that they're selling to their customers,
and we can take care of the business side.
- Got you.

So, with that security
must be in your DNA?
- Absolutely.

I mean, in order for us to remain trusted
partners for our everyday entrepreneurs,

it's like security has
to be a part of our DNA.

And that means that we have
to put it into consideration

for every design element
that we talk through.
- Got you.

With that, how do you implement
that in your environment?
- Absolutely.
Maybe we can walk through an example.
As a user, if they say,

“Hey, I want to create an application
in our public cloud environment.”

They'll go to this thing here
called a public cloud portal.

And that's really where
they start their journey.
- So in that portal, what does it do?

Yeah, so it gives them full
visibility into what stage they're in

before they can take
production traffic in the cloud.

That'll go through a lot of
that cloud readiness review,

which is another name for the
process that they walk through,
is based on AWS, as well protected,

which is where we took
our jumping off point.

It's going to go through your
application security, your security,
your compliance, your privacy,

and several different aspects to be
able to create this environment that says,

here's my project, what organization
do I need to be a part of?

We have three organizations
that they can select from.

And based off of that,
they'll get seven accounts created

before they're even
ready to take production.

So, in that up to six of those accounts
are non-production accounts

where they can be in Dev,
Dev private, et cetera,

completely isolated,
and then one CI/CD account,

which is the only account
that I can reach in and do deployments.

- As a solution architect,
what are some of the best practices

that we need to consider
within our design?
- Absolutely.

So, if we look at this
and say that this is account A,
and this is account B,
this line here.

Let’s say in account A, there's some
sort of vulnerability that was exploited,

because of these account boundaries,
essentially,
you can consider this account isolated.
If we need to pull this account

and say, “Hey, we need
to run forensics on it.”

You can consider it a contained
environment for that vulnerability.

We can run forensics on it
and even detonate it if needed,
reducing that blast radius.

So it wouldn't actually affect account B
where we can then rebuild account A.

- So how are you preventing
that lateral movement?
- VPC peering. We don't allow that.

If we need to have communications,
we have either direct connect available

if they need to speak to
your on-prem services,
or where you utilize our NAT gateway.
- Got you.
And with that, I see that you have EKS,
do you do some level of rotations?
We do.

Within EKS we have node rotations
that happen every 24 hours.

They have to rebuild every 24 hours
based on our Golden AMI
that has all the latest security patches,
all the latest security features, right?

So worst case scenario is a threat
actor exploits vulnerability
or zero day or something,

they can only live up to 24 hours
before everything is broken down

and built backup from
the latest and greatest.

So, with those node rotations,
and this isolation in place

that really allows us to contain
and put security best practice in place.

Additionally, on that account level, we do
have run about 80 checks every four hours

that says, “Are you sure
you're not doing VPC peering?

What are your vulnerability scans?
What are your configurations?

Are you rotating off of that
Golden AMI on that ongoing basis?”

So that really allows us to
strengthen our security posture.
- Awesome.

So, through node ration to always have
the latest OS and when you're deploying

and also providing that account boundary
and isolation to reduce the blast radius

really encompasses that
zero trust environment?
- Yes, absolutely.
- Awesome.

Well, thank you so much
for going over your architecture.

That is amazing, how you're able
to enforce these best practices

so that you can be this trusted
partner for your customers.
So thank you for that.
- Absolutely. Thank you so much.

- Thank you for watching,
'This is My Architecture'.
